description.narrative: The project development objective is to improve irrigation service delivery on a sustainable basis that will contribute to increased agricultural productivity among irrigation farmers. This will be achieved through further development of water users associations (WUAs) and rehabilitation and modernization of irrigation and drainage infrastructure.

participating-org.narrative: Department of Water Resources and Land Improvement

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I.A.4 | Description :All rehabilitation and construction works shall be selected inaccordance with criteria and procedures acceptable to IDA. | Frequency :Quarterly

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I.A.5 | Description :Laws and regulations in force governing the setting of irrigationservice fees shall not be amended in a manner which will adversely affect the implementation of the Project activities. | Frequency:Quarterly
Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I.A.8 | Description :WUA Support Units shall be maintained with adequate technical andfinancial resources. | Frequency :Quarterly

title.narrative: Evidence, for the WUA as a whole and tail-end farmers in particular, of increased agricultural productivity in at least 90 percent of OIP-2 schemes from the third agricultural season after completion
Operational water user associations created and/or strengthened (number)

OIP-2 rehabilitated system's ability to supply controlled volumes of water to match water users requests and remove surplus drainage water (measured in number of WUAs where rehabilitation works comple
Number of WUAs where the in-season scheduling and distribution procedures follow the updated procedures.
WUA SU staff trained in new topics (water management, asset and maintenance management, etc.) and able to apply learning to training of WUA personnel (measured in number of person days of training)
Number of man-months of temporary employment generated by rehabilitation works
Number of WUAs that have benefited from rehabilitation) that have revised their ISF fee level and are moving towards the agreed target level for ISF (as assessed from asset and maintenance studies).
Collection rates by WUAs at least 90 percent of total assessed fees (based on updated annual O&M plans) from the third agriculturalseason after completion of rehabilitation works.
Number of WUAs where the seasonal water allocation plans are prepared according to the updated procedures.
Disbursement Rate – Percentage of approved budget.
Number of WUAs where asset management plans prepared, approved by the WUA Representative/General Assembly, and contributing to the setting of the ISF.
Number of WUAs where minimum maintenance expenditure for sustainable operation identified and used in setting the ISF.
Water distribution to farmers within 80 percent of the rehabilitated systems closely matches the crops irrigation water demands.
Water users provided with new/improved irrigation and drainage services (number)
Water users provided with irrigation and drainage services - female (number)
Number of WUAs with well informed water users actively interacting with WUA management through their zonal representatives.
At least 80 percent of WUAs judged to be representative, transparent, and accountable to their members.
90 percent of all legally established WUAs interviewed assess the WUA SU performance as satisfactory or above.
Evidence, in at least 80 percent of WUAs, of well-informed water users satisfied with the performance of the WUA management.

baseline.value: Medium evidence (< 50 % of users in each WUA)

target.value: High evidence (at least 90% in 90% of registered WUAs

actual.value: 87% of water users satisfied with the performance of the WUA management.

title.narrative: Project management capacity in Implementation Agency enhanced, and project implementation schedule adhered to.
Number of WUA Federations formed, operational, and effective.
Area provided with irrigation and drainage services (ha)
Area provided with irrigation and drainage services - Improved (ha)
Number of WUAs that are fully paid up members of the National Union of WUAs.
Number of Water Councils formed, operational, and effective.
